snippet: The conviction of two men for the kidnapping of Jennifer Negron in Brooklyn relied on what might have been an informer-for-hire, according to a witness.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column holds that sloppy murder investigations in Brooklyn in 1990s were not limited to Detective Louis Scarcella, lead detective in roughly 50 old murder convictions now under review by Brooklyn district attorney's office; notes cases handled by Detective Michael Race, whose work with untrustworthy informants led to murder convictions for at least three innocent people.
lead_paragraph: The conviction of two men for the kidnapping of Jennifer Negron in Brooklyn relied on what might have been an informer-for-hire, according to a witness.

headline.main: In a 1992 Murder, Evidence of Flawed Justice
headline.print_headline: In a 1992 Murder, Evidence of Flawed Justice and an Informant Who Lied
